channel.title: Dragon hatchet
channel.description: heres a all prim dragon hatchet i made [IMG]http://i46.tinypic.com/33upuo7.jpg[/img] [IMG]http://i46.tinypic.com/2z53lz4.jpg[/img] [IMG]http://i50.tinypic.com/2gvnh5f.jpg[/img] please post CC and dont just do an empty flame.

item.title: Dragon hatchet
item.dc:creator: @Java_Is_My_Bitch2 Java Is My Bitch
item.description:
@Java_Is_My_Bitch2 wrote:

[quote=“rip4d, post:7, topic:346166”][quote author=The Arcanian link=topic=442548.msg3250502#msg3250502 date=1277713760]
Thunderflea, ive seen almost every topic with your work. Could you please improve and only then post your models?
Now, all of your models look like you spent 5 mins on them, and like wanted to make them so crappy.

Don’t post every “model” you make.
Keep on trying until you make something good.
Imo, you should make more polygons, and then round and shape them as you want.
Gonna make some tut’s right now and post them to youtube. Ill pm you later.
[/quote]I completely disagree with you. If he doesn’t post his models for us to see, how will he know that they are getting better? In case you haven’t noticed, he isn’t showing off, he is asking for CC, so there isn’t any need for you to tell him to improve and then post his models.

@Topic:
I suppose its decent for a first primitive model, but you have to learn to manipulate the primitives more. I have a video on my youtube channel showing me making a sword using basic primitive manipulation, I’m not sure if I showed you it already, but here:
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=s8gyoS6wRTE[/quote]I actually agree with him, you need to practice a little before you go around posting your models, sometimes criticism is useless if you don’t know how to use it.

Read full topic

item.title: Dragon hatchet
item.dc:creator: @shrogg shrogg
item.description:
@shrogg wrote:

wow, now that was a good post dylan xD
but yeah, modlers need better feedback than “omg realeace pl0x” and “5/10”…
we need stuff like “you could probally round the handle abit more and if you can, join the handles faces to the blade for a seemless look”

thats the kind of stuff we want.

Read full topic

item.title: Dragon hatchet
item.dc:creator: @dylan_0789 dylan_0789
item.description:
@dylan_0789 wrote:

No, Arcanian is right. Stop basing your personal progress on others opinions. You should know when you progress. Lets be honest, I’m never told whether or not theres any progress from you guys, its always ‘Cool!’ ‘sweet’ 'not bad, ‘7/10’ and things like that (some are criticizing ofcourse). I’m never told when I progress, but I still progress, do I not? Stop being so poly-shy and show us what you can really do. Show us the unique style that you as an individual possesses; the style we cant immitate perfectly. You need to be able to filter the criticism and take into account what is their personal stylistic choices and what will actually improve your skills. How do you expect to better yourself and develop a unique style if you just take everything they say and apply it? If I took in every single bit of CC I’ve ever been given, I would be only half as good as now and have no individual style as I’d be basing it on everyone elses. Heres what I suggest: Keep modeling using as much poly as you feel necessary but don’t post it here until you feel you cannot improve it, that is when others opinions come in because THAT is when you can best filter the criticism.

Read full topic

item.title: Dragon hatchet
item.dc:creator: @the_elve_age the elve age
item.description:
@the_elve_age wrote:

Ignore Arcanian.

Keep posting your models here for CC.

When your going to make the tip of the axe (the point)
Try to line it up with the handle.
